solution_line_template: Mara spent ${bumper_car_ticket} x {mara_bumper_car_rides} = $<<{bumper_car_ticket}*{mara_bumper_car_rides}={mara_bumper_car_total}>>{mara_bumper_car_total} for riding the bumper car two times.

Riley spent ${space_shuttle_ticket} x {riley_space_shuttle_rides} = $<<{space_shuttle_ticket}*{riley_space_shuttle_rides}={riley_space_shuttle_total}>>{riley_space_shuttle_total} for riding the space shuttle 4 times.

They spent ${ferris_wheel_ticket} x {ferris_wheel_rides_each} = $<<{ferris_wheel_ticket}*{ferris_wheel_rides_each}={ferris_wheel_total_per_person}>>{ferris_wheel_total_per_person} each riding the Ferris wheel 3 times.
So, they spent a total of ${ferris_wheel_total_per_person} x {num_people}= $<<{ferris_wheel_total_per_person}*{num_people}={ferris_wheel_total}>>{ferris_wheel_total} riding the Ferris wheel.

Therefore the total amount they spent at the carnival is ${mara_bumper_car_total} + ${riley_space_shuttle_total} + ${ferris_wheel_total} = $<<{mara_bumper_car_total}+{riley_space_shuttle_total}+{ferris_wheel_total}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}.
